alert.note: Alert for Hancock; McDonough (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 04 at 11:32PM CST until January 05 at 6:00PM CST by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Blowing and drifting snow expected. Winds of 20 to 35 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. Wind chills of 10 to 20 below zero. Some snow flurries are also possible. * WHERE...Hancock and McDonough Counties. * WHEN...Until 6 PM CST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. The cold wind chills as low as 20 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling, especially in open areas. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 for Iowa, or by visiting 511ia.org, modot.org, or idot.Illinois.gov.
